sentence.Network_en: What the reporters got from him was just political doublespeak.
sentence.Network_cn: 记者从他那里所得到的,无非是官话.

sentence.Network_en: This is what has been frequently referred to as " doublespeak " or " public lying ".
sentence.Network_cn: 这就是人们时常提及的 “?M人 之谈 ” 或 “ 公众谎言 ”.

...（garden- path sentence）与“双言巧语” （doublespeak）是近年来语言学研究的新现象，国内外学者曾对此进行过深入细致的研究。

entry.tran: 含糊其辞的话;欺人之谈
entry.def: If you refer to what someone says as doublespeak, you are criticizing them for presenting things in a way that is intended to hide the truth or give people the wrong idea.

example.ex: ...the doublespeak so fluently used by governments and their press offices.
example.tran: 被政府及其新闻办公室运用自如的欺人之谈

means.word_mean: 1. any language that pretends to communicate but actually does not

auth_sentence.content: Sorry if someone's nifty spin or fancy doublespeak led you to get a couple things backwards.
